description: Explore CPU architecture, memory, logic gates, and I/O systems

slides.title: Welcome to Computer Hardware
slides.content:
# Introduction to Computer Hardware

Welcome to **Computer Hardware** - the physical side of computing!

## What You Will Learn:
- **CPU** - The processor
- **Memory** - RAM and storage
- **Logic Gates** - Building blocks
- **Storage** - HDD, SSD
- **I/O Systems** - Input and output

> **Fun Fact:** Modern CPUs have billions of transistors smaller than a virus!

slides.title: CPU Basics
slides.content:
# Central Processing Unit (CPU)

## Functions:
- Fetch instructions
- Decode instructions
- Execute operations
- Store results

## Components:
| Component | Function |
|-----------|----------|
| ALU | Arithmetic/logic operations |
| Control Unit | Coordinates execution |
| Registers | Fast temporary storage |
| Cache | Quick access memory |

## Performance Factors:
- Clock speed (GHz)
- Number of cores
- Cache size
- Architecture efficiency

slides.title: CPU Architecture
slides.content:
# CPU Architecture

## Instruction Cycle:
1. **Fetch:** Get instruction from memory
2. **Decode:** Interpret instruction
3. **Execute:** Perform operation
4. **Store:** Write result

## Pipelining:
- Multiple instructions in progress
- Increases throughput
- Hazards can cause stalls

## Multi-core:
- Multiple processors on one chip
- Parallel processing
- Shared cache

## RISC vs CISC:
| RISC | CISC |
|------|------|
| Simple instructions | Complex instructions |
| Fixed length | Variable length |
| ARM | x86 |

slides.title: Memory Hierarchy
slides.content:
# Memory Hierarchy

## Levels (fastest to slowest):

| Level | Type | Size | Speed |
|-------|------|------|-------|
| 1 | Registers | Bytes | Fastest |
| 2 | Cache (L1/L2/L3) | KB-MB | Very fast |
| 3 | RAM | GB | Fast |
| 4 | SSD | TB | Medium |
| 5 | HDD | TB | Slow |

## Trade-offs:
- Faster = More expensive
- Faster = Smaller capacity

## Cache Levels:
- L1: Smallest, fastest, per core
- L2: Larger, slower
- L3: Shared between cores

slides.title: RAM and Types
slides.content:
# RAM (Random Access Memory)

## Characteristics:
- Volatile (data lost when power off)
- Fast random access
- Temporary storage

## Types:

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| DRAM | Dynamic, needs refresh |
| SRAM | Static, faster, cache |
| DDR | Double data rate |
| DDR5 | Latest generation |

## DDR Generations:
- DDR3: 1066-2133 MT/s
- DDR4: 2133-3200 MT/s
- DDR5: 4800-8400+ MT/s

## Dual Channel:
- Two memory modules
- Double bandwidth

slides.title: Logic Gates
slides.content:
# Logic Gates

## Basic Gates:

| Gate | Function | Output 1 when |
|------|----------|---------------|
| AND | A and B | Both inputs 1 |
| OR | A or B | Either input 1 |
| NOT | Invert | Input is 0 |
| NAND | NOT AND | Not both 1 |
| NOR | NOT OR | Neither is 1 |
| XOR | Exclusive OR | Exactly one is 1 |

## Universal Gates:
- NAND can make any gate
- NOR can make any gate

## Building Blocks:
- Gates -> Adders -> ALU
- Gates -> Flip-flops -> Memory

slides.title: Boolean Algebra
slides.content:
# Boolean Algebra

## Basic Operations:
```
AND: A dot B or AB
OR: A + B
NOT: A' or ~A
```

## Laws:
```
Identity: A + 0 = A, A dot 1 = A
Null: A + 1 = 1, A dot 0 = 0
Complement: A + A' = 1, A dot A' = 0
```

## De Morgan's Laws:
```
(AB)' = A' + B'
(A + B)' = A' dot B'
```

## Applications:
- Circuit simplification
- Code optimization
- Logic design

slides.title: Storage Devices - HDD
slides.content:
# Hard Disk Drive (HDD)

## How It Works:
- Spinning magnetic platters
- Read/write head on arm
- Data stored magnetically

## Specifications:
| Spec | Typical |
|------|--------|
| Capacity | 1-20 TB |
| Speed | 5400-7200 RPM |
| Read speed | 100-200 MB/s |
| Access time | 5-10 ms |

## Advantages:
- Large capacity
- Low cost per GB
- Good for archives

## Disadvantages:
- Mechanical = fragile
- Slower than SSD
- More power consumption

slides.title: Storage Devices - SSD
slides.content:
# Solid State Drive (SSD)

## How It Works:
- Flash memory (NAND)
- No moving parts
- Electrical storage

## Specifications:
| Spec | Typical |
|------|--------|
| Capacity | 128 GB - 8 TB |
| Read speed | 500-7000 MB/s |
| Write speed | 400-5000 MB/s |
| Access time | 0.05-0.1 ms |

## Types:
- SATA SSD: ~550 MB/s
- NVMe SSD: 3000-7000 MB/s

## Advantages:
- Much faster
- No moving parts
- Silent, durable

## Disadvantages:
- Higher cost per GB
- Write endurance limits

slides.title: Input/Output Systems
slides.content:
# Input/Output (I/O) Systems

## Input Devices:
- Keyboard
- Mouse
- Scanner
- Microphone
- Camera

## Output Devices:
- Monitor
- Printer
- Speakers
- Projector

## I/O Communication:
| Method | Description |
|--------|------------|
| Polling | CPU checks device status |
| Interrupts | Device signals CPU |
| DMA | Direct memory access |

## Buses:
- Address bus: Location
- Data bus: Information
- Control bus: Commands

slides.title: Ports and Interfaces
slides.content:
# Ports and Interfaces

## Common Ports:

| Port | Speed | Use |
|------|-------|-----|
| USB 2.0 | 480 Mbps | Peripherals |
| USB 3.0 | 5 Gbps | Fast transfer |
| USB-C | Up to 40 Gbps | Universal |
| HDMI | N/A | Video/audio |
| DisplayPort | N/A | High-res display |
| Ethernet | 1-10 Gbps | Network |
| SATA | 6 Gbps | Storage |
| PCIe | 16+ GB/s | Expansion cards |

## Thunderbolt:
- High speed (40 Gbps+)
- Daisy chaining
- Power delivery

slides.title: Motherboard
slides.content:
# Motherboard

## Main PCB connecting all components.

## Key Components:
| Component | Function |
|-----------|----------|
| CPU socket | Processor mounting |
| RAM slots | Memory modules |
| PCIe slots | Graphics, expansion |
| Chipset | Communication hub |
| BIOS/UEFI | Boot firmware |
| Power connectors | Electricity |

## Form Factors:
- ATX: Standard desktop
- Micro-ATX: Smaller
- Mini-ITX: Compact builds

## BIOS/UEFI:
- Basic Input/Output System
- Boot sequence
- Hardware configuration

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Computer Hardware Summary

## CPU:
- Fetch, decode, execute, store
- Cores, cache, clock speed

## Memory:
| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Cache | Fastest, CPU-close |
| RAM | Volatile, working memory |
| SSD/HDD | Permanent storage |

## Logic Gates:
- AND, OR, NOT, NAND, XOR
- Build all digital circuits

## Storage:
- HDD: Large, cheap, slow
- SSD: Fast, no moving parts

## I/O:
- Buses connect components
- Ports for external devices

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Computer Hardware!
